title: Stock Futures Edge Higher After Christmas Holiday
sub_head: Investors are braced for higher volatility over the holiday season due to uncertainty of the economic impact of the Omicron variant of Covid-19
body:
U.S. stock futures grinded higher, with little news driving markets after the Christmas holiday.
Futures for the S&P 500 were up 0.2% Monday. The index hit its 68th record close of 2021 Thursday. U.S. markets were closed Friday for the holiday. Contracts for the tech-focused Nasdaq-100 edged up, and futures for the Dow Jones Industrial Average were flat.
